mysql

Interface DBIcrawler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DBcrawler

    public interface DBIcrawler
    interface for writing data into a database
    Author:
    Holger Ebhart

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean[] addAccount(twitter4j.User user, java.lang.String location, java.util.Date date, boolean tweet)
      insert an account into the database
      boolean addDay(java.util.Date date)
      inserts a new date into the database
      boolean addLocationString(java.lang.String code, java.lang.String word, java.lang.String timeZone)
      inserts a location-code - word combination to the database
      boolean[] addRetweet(long id, java.lang.String location, java.util.Date date)
      inserts a retweet into the database, if it's still in the database the counter will be increased
      boolean containsAccount(long id)
      returns if an account with this id is even in the database
      java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Long> getAccounts()
      returns all AccountId's from the database
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getLocationStrings()
      returns a threadsafe hashmap that maps words from the database to location-codes
      long[] getNonVerifiedAccounts()
      returns all AccountId's that aren't verified

    • Method Detail

      • addAccount

        boolean[] addAccount(twitter4j.User user,
                   java.lang.String location,
                   java.util.Date date,
                   boolean tweet)
        insert an account into the database
        Parameters:
        user - the user to add as User
        location - the location of the account as String
        date - the date of the tweet as Date
        tweet - true if a tweet status object has been read, false if a retweets status object has been read
        Returns:
        boolean-array with three results of the database requests. First is the result of adding the location, second is result for adding the account and third is for adding the tweet.

      • addRetweet

        boolean[] addRetweet(long id,
                   java.lang.String location,
                   java.util.Date date)
        inserts a retweet into the database, if it's still in the database the counter will be increased
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the account who's tweet was retweeted as long
        location - the location of the retweet as String (null if could not been localized)
        date - the day when the retweet has been written as Date
        Returns:
        database-request result as Boolean[]

      • addDay

        boolean addDay(java.util.Date date)
        inserts a new date into the database
        Parameters:
        date - the date to write into the database as Date
        Returns:
        database-request result as Boolean

      • getNonVerifiedAccounts

        long[] getNonVerifiedAccounts()
        returns all AccountId's that aren't verified
        Returns:
        all AccountId's from the database that aren't verified as Integer-Array, null if an error occurred

      • getAccounts

        java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Long> getAccounts()
        returns all AccountId's from the database
        Returns:
        all AccountId's from the database as HashSet, empty if an error occurred

      • getLocationStrings

        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getLocationStrings()
        returns a threadsafe hashmap that maps words from the database to location-codes
        Returns:
        a threadsafe hashmap that maps words from the database to location-codes as HashMap

      • addLocationString

        boolean addLocationString(java.lang.String code,
                        java.lang.String word,
                        java.lang.String timeZone)
        inserts a location-code - word combination to the database
        Parameters:
        code - the location-code as String (max. length 3)
        word - the word to connect with the location-code as String (max. length 250)
        timeZone - the timezone of the location as String (max. length 200)
        Returns:
        true if data has been insert into the database, else false

      • containsAccount

        boolean containsAccount(long id)
        returns if an account with this id is even in the database
        Parameters:
        id - the id to check as long
        Returns:
        true if an account with this id is in the database, else false
